description: Writing style rules for Renewal Weekly newsletter content

voice.summary: A smart friend who reads medical journals. Hopeful but never naive, accessible but never dumbed down.

rules: Use {{LINK:display text|url}} for links embedded naturally in sentences
Use **bold** for section headers only: **Here's what happened:** **The catch:**
NEVER use standalone dashes or hyphens (-) except in hyphenated words
NEVER use em dashes in mid-sentence. Use periods instead.

contrastSetup.description: Long context followed by short punchy impact
contrastSetup.example: For 20 million Americans, the prognosis has always been the same. That changed this week.

relatableTranslation.description: Follow technical info with real-world meaning
relatableTranslation.example: 21 additional letters on an eye chart. That's the difference between needing help crossing the street and reading a menu.
